section.title: The Pin Nodes Page
section.para: The Pin Nodes Page contains tools for pinning &nodes; so that they don't move during &skel; modifications. The page provides a GUI for the commands in the menu. See the documentation for for an illustration of how pinning can be helpful.

The anatomy of the Pin Nodes Page, as shown in , is similar to many other &oof2; task pages. At the top is a Skeleton Chooser, which selects the &skel; that the rest of the page operates on. Below the Skeleton Chooser on the left is an information pane, and on the right is the Modification Pane, containing a set of tools for modifying the set of pinned &nodes; in the selected &skel;. These tools all reside in the menu.

section.title: The Information Pane
section.para: The Information Pane simply displays the number of nodes in the current &skel; and the number of them that are pinned.

section.title: The Modification Pane
section.para: The Modification Pane contains a pull-down menu, labelled Method, for choosing a tool that modifies the current set of pinned &nodes; in the current &skel;. For details on the methods, see the commands in the menu. Below the pull-down menu is a region for displaying the parameters of the current command, if any.

At the bottom of the Modification Pane are a set of buttons:
The OK button applies the currently selected modification method to the pinned &nodes; in the current &skel;.
The Undo and Redo buttons undo and redo the latest pinning operations.
The Unpin All button unpins all of the &nodes; in the &skel;.
The Invert button pins all of the unpinned &nodes; and unpins all of the pinned &nodes;.
